meanings.definition: A punctuation mark (\) used to separate elements in a file path or to indicate a division in a URL.
meanings.sent1: I typed a backslash to show the folder structure on my computer.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use a backslash when writing the file directory.
meanings.sent3: The backslash on the screen looked like a tiny bridge between words.
meanings.sent4: The backslash acted as a gatekeeper, keeping the website address in order.
meanings.sent5: The backslash is like a tiny fence that keeps the parts of the web address organized.

meanings.sent1: He had to backslash to avoid the obstacle.
meanings.sent2: The car had to backslash to get out of the narrow alley.
meanings.sent3: The dancer's backslash surprised the audience with its smoothness.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was backslashing through time as she retraced her steps.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's backslash was quick and efficient, gaining him an advantage in the race.

meanings.definition: To support or assist someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I will backslash you in your project presentation.
meanings.sent2: Friends should always backslash each other in times of need.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to backslash the new member to help them settle in.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words backslashed his confidence before the big game.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's guidance was a strong backslash for the young entrepreneur.
